lexUnit.name: mollify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: appease the anger or anxiety of.

sentence.text: If his generosity was occasioned by concern at the growth of Edmund 's cult , and its connection with Swegen and taxation , it may have been principally an attempt to mollify the opposition by making much of patronising the saint himself .
Later , I tried to mollify her by pointing out that the teacher had said what a nice boy he was .
There is no point in complaining ; they may try to mollify you in their irritatingly good English , but they will not have a clue what you are so anxious about .
Later , however , I did tell him that the meeting had been a disaster and that if he thought it had mollified the press in any way he was greatly mistaken .
Nature reserves were set up around new power stations to mollify local conservationists .
Her shock seemed to mollify him .
` And I 'm glad that I wo n't have to mollify Mr Chapter Clerk . "
None of these points will mollify the biggest Tory sceptics .
None of these is intended simply to mollify reluctant staff : each is intended to provide more time , to allow a fresh look to be taken or to try out different approaches when there are setbacks .
The resisters were more offended by de Gaulle 's attack on their autonomy and by his restoration of the state apparatus than they were mollified by his reforms .
But Pat Milligan was in no mood to be mollified .
Susan got it , but Bellamy was appalled and had to be mollified .
But Cinzia was not to be mollified .
He was not to be mollified .
The latter were mollified to some extent by the exclusion from the Treaty of anything that would bar some members from forming a smaller customs union ahead of the EEC schedule .
So many people had to be pleased or mollified , and it was trying to do so many things at once , that the pages were hopelessly crammed with bitty stories .
I refuse to be mollified with coffee .
These can go a very long way to mollifying those individuals whose journeys are lengthened by traffic-affecting measures .

Kilmer is part-Indian and is expected to exploit this to mollify the natives but Kilmer rediscovers his tribal heritage while Shepard finds the politics of an already volatile situation beginning to spin out of control .
By the time Constance had dropped off Louise , who was not mollified by being given a lift to her door , it was past six .
The old man sounded mollified by the flattery , and Harry continued .
